feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 16 at 7:42PM AKST until December 17 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow occurring. Blowing snow expected. Visibility will be reduced to one half mile at times Friday. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches are expected.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Yukon Delta

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow occurring. Blowing snow expected. Visibility will be reduced to one half mile at times Friday. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches are expected.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Yukon Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 16 at 6:06PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Series of storms will impact the area into next week... A weather system moving through the Bering Sea will reach the Lower Yukon Delta Friday morning spreading snow to the area through the day. Snowfall with this system will spread north and east into Saturday with 3 to 8 inches of snowfall south of the Bering Strait by Saturday morning, with 1 to 4 inches of

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 16 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Snowfall Possible Sunday night to Tuesday... Heavy snowfall is possible Sunday night into Tuesday across the Central and Eastern Interior, including Fairbanks. Snowfall amounts of 6 to 12 inches will be possible over the two days. This weather system will also bring some warmer air into the area and the potential for some freezing rain. entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued December 16 at 5:50PM AKST until December 17 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Cold wind chills as low as 50 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin.
